Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System - Tigecycline (0.25 - 16μg/mL)
BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent Tigecycline (0.25 - 16ug/mL) - Gram-negative ID/AST or AST only Phoenix Panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully automated short-term incubation cycle antimicrobial susceptibility system
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System with Tigecycline for rapid organism identification and antimicrobial susceptibility testing by MIC.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria (Enterobacteriaceae and Non-Enterobacteriaceae) and Gram-positive bacteria (Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, Streptococcus) from pure culture using Tigecycline in Gram-negative ID/AST or AST only panels.
